description: In 1953, at the Shell lab in Amsterdam, the first electronic calculator was taken into production in the Netherlands. Shell's new computer was called Miracle, and it was not just an invention; it was a collection of several inventions. To name a few: RAM memory, magnetic memory, electronic printers, instruction sets, monitors.
